name.text: 15.2.2.3 x coordinate of COM of triangular lamina

questiontext.text:
Exercise

This is the first in a series of three exercises to find the centre of mass of the plane lamina shown below.

The coordinates of \(\bar{x}\) and \(\bar{y}\) must be calculated separately. In this exercise we calculate \(\bar{x}\) as we did before.

  1. Let \(\rho\) equal the mass per unit area. The total mass \(m\) is then

    \(m=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]
    Enter rho for \(\rho\).

    Its moment about the \(y\)-axis is then \(m\bar{x}\).

  2. To calculate \(\bar{x}\) the lamina is divided into thin slices; a typical slice is shown in the figure above. We approximate the area of the slice with the largest rectangle of width \(\delta x\) which fits within the slice. Calculate the mass of the rectangle.

    Mass of rectangle: [[input:ans6]] [[validation:ans6]] [[feedback:prt6]]

  3. Write down the moment about the \(y\)-axis of the typical strip, assuming the mass is a point mass on the leftmost edge of the rectangle. 

    Moment of rectangle: [[input:ans7]] [[validation:ans7]] [[feedback:prt7]]

  4. We sum the moments of all rectangular strips and take the limit as \(\delta x \to 0\) to obtain the integral:

    \( \displaystyle{\int_{0}^{2}}\)[[input:ans8]]\(\ \textrm{d}x\)[[validation:ans8]][[feedback:prt8]].

  5.  Evaluate the integral from the previous part to find the moment: [[input:ans9]] [[validation:ans9]] [[feedback:prt9]]

  6. Equating the moments from parts (a) and (e) we find \(\bar{x}=\) [[input:ans10]] [[validation:ans10]] [[feedback:prt10]]

The next questions will illustrate two alternative ways of calculating \(\bar{y}\).

generalfeedback.text:
1. \(2 \rho \bar{x}\)
  2. \(\rho \times (y \delta x)\)
  3. \((\rho x^2 \delta x) \)
  4. \(\displaystyle{\int_0^2 x^2 \rho \mathrm{d}x = \left[\dfrac{\rho x^3}{3}\right]_0^2 = \dfrac{8 \rho}{3}-0=\dfrac{8 \rho}{3}.}\)
  5. \(2 \rho \bar{x}=\dfrac{8 \rho}{3}\) so that \(\bar{x} = 4/3\).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
